intro: Anemonoides albida, commonly known as the white anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes various species of buttercups and crowfoots. The plant features showy, white to pale yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets, and are covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Anemonoides albida thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
